Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 01:27PM leoscat wrote: Thanks guys... the biopy was done yestrday. It was suprisingly pain free...The best I can hope for is that he gets enough cells...  the doc alreay warned that if we get a "benign" result, it just means we need to do a different type of biopsy. I am glad they have been up front with me....helps me to prep and gear up for battle so to speak. I can tell by looking at the films that we are probably looking at a I.D.C.     thanks again...
Posts.Title: diagnosis by mamo and us? leoscat Vinogal

Posts.Content: leoscat wrote: Hi all, newby here. Last week i had a mamo and us for a lump i had found. Before I left the office, the radiologist called me in. He was very straight forward as I requested. He showed me the mamo films and us stills. I asked him what the chance of it being cancerus vs benign. He said he wouldn't give me a zero chance of it being benign, but that he felt 80% chance of it being cancerus. From then on, he referred to the lesion as ca. He said all we needed to do now wa to prove it. I am scheduled for a core bx in 2 days. Has anyone else experienced this on a first visit? Thanks for the time... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: diagnosis by mamo and us? leoscat Vinogal
